title: Chapatis
directions: Put the flour in a bowl and make a well
Gradually mix in the water until a soft, but not sticky, dough is formed (add a little more flour or water if needed)
Knead for about 10 minutes and leave to rest in the fridge for 30-60 minutes
Roll into very thin rounds with a little flour
Heat a frying pan (or tava) - when the pan is hot place a chapati in the pan
When bubbles appear, turn and cook the other side
ingredients: Serve hot with any curry. Brush with a little ghee or oil for an authentic taste.
